1 like 1 opinion on this.

Broad. May check back in in the morning. https://t.co/NkrBSABIjN

This is a minefield if I‚Äôm not careful. 

Masculine does not mean biologically male. It means traits that are usually associated with biological males.

(There‚Äôs the grammatical use of the word too, like ‚Äúle‚Äù vs ‚Äúla‚Äù in French. But we‚Äôll maybe return to that later)

Breaking the ‚Äúmale is and should be 100% masculine‚Äù stereotype was a good.

But we humans are shit at probabilities. Too many people now think ‚Äúbiological sex both *is* and *should* be unrelated to masculine/feminine behavior‚Äù

That view is an ‚Äúought‚Äù with no supporting ‚Äúis‚Äù

Like nearly every other two-sex species, we‚Äôve specialized. 

Masculinity is mostly male.

But there are many kinds. Good and bad.

Jung and those folks talk a lot about ‚Äúlight‚Äù and ‚Äúshadow‚Äù forms of masculinity.

For most folks today that‚Äôs too much woo. That‚Äôs just a language problem [1].

There are good and bad forms of masculinity. That‚Äôs really what we‚Äôre getting at

[1]
https://t.co/VPSlCiIxCW

Bad versions of masculinity are all the rage these days. Violence against women, wars and aggression, domineering behavior at work, etc.

Who‚Äôs talking about positive masculine role models?

We aren‚Äôt allowed to. 

We got rid of the overly-constricting ~1950s-era constricting masculinity and replaced it with ‚Äúno that‚Äôs bad be more sensitive, caring, etc et ‚Äú

These are all good things. But they are feminine archetypes.

We‚Äôre mostly allowed to tell men to be women. https://t.co/IU6ejZixpW

Masculinity, at heart, is a set of high variance strategies. Constrained by things like being used in war more than females (90% of combat deaths are men).

Masculine is about ~strength and risk taking. When it pays off big, wee! When it doesn‚Äôt, death/prison.
there are some canaries that hint at how we‚Äôre going wrong with speaking about positive masculinity. The happiest relationships are ones where the couples have more ‚Äútraditional‚Äù roles.

(Interlude: I‚Äôm going skiing today. An activity based around risk assessment, physical feats, fears, and overcoming the elements. These are parts of the positive masculine. Most skiers are men. 

I‚Äôll be back to this thread in a bit. AFK doing stiff like this: https://t.co/03JUmnvvc5

Aside: I have this strange sense of outsideness when talking about masculinity. I feel far more feminine than the average male. I learned to cook from my mom. Hyper sensitive. Counsel friends in breakups. 

I came to masculinity as an adult. 

... and learned it was already there

Masculinity as an evolutionary strategy, *in humans*, is driven by sexual selection.

Compared to most species, we leave the gene pool when no mate wants us, not because nature killed us too soon.

Nature doesn‚Äôt select for masculinity, (biological) women do.

You have twice as many female ancestors as male. Something like 70% of men on dating sites are rated ‚Äúbelow average‚Äù by women.

You wanna know where fragile masculinity comes from? Historically, masculine reproductive strategies are *individually* very fragile.
(Again: this is a minefield. Eg I am not saying that *lashing out* physically as a result of a damaged masculine ego is ok)

But we should be aware that the masculine is high risk, high reward. and we encourage it. The heroic adventure, warrior, etc. the few that do really well and make us all better for it are glorified. The ones who fail? Where do you think ‚Äúa warrior‚Äôs burial‚Äù comes from?
Applied math aside: culture evolved to have one of the sexes have a high-risk, asymmetric bet strategy. This is one major aspect of masculinity.

Let‚Äôs zoom down into the micro for a while: how can one be healthily masculine?

Walking the tighrope of strength and compassion, which are themselves both a balance:

Strength, not brutality or meekness.

Compassion, not ruinous empathy or coldness.

Why is this so hard? We learn by doing and imitating. There are basically very few positive male archetypes. All the men (and some masculine women) I know that seem to have their shit together had to go out into the wilderness to figure it out themselves.

We live in a time devoid of major strands of healthy masculine heroes. The constricting society before the 60s counter culture did need to be broken down. it was too rigid.

What we have now is not enough healthy masculine to lead or model on.

But there is hope

The feminine is often a challenge to the masculine. Biologically: can you take care of me and our children?

Culturally: can you take care of us and our lineage?

The answer to the second in the ~1950s became ‚Äúno‚Äù.

Now I‚Äôm going to go out on a limb and get weird

The ‚Äúgrievance studies‚Äù and ~postmodern cluster of ideas is what happened when the originally-correct feminine critique went too far and metastasized. 

It had no healthy masculine cultural movement to meet its challenge. And it became a movement that went too far.

There is a crisis of masculinity, but the crisis is not *that* masculinity exists. It‚Äôs that weak straw men of masculinity is what‚Äôs out there

But there is hope. The masculine is coming back into balance. Look for the ‚ÄúKing‚Äù meme. 

https://t.co/t15niPpMkA

we are in another wave of the masculine/feminine archetypes of society in a healthy coop-etition. The masculine has waned. To respond, you dont become feminine. You become a better version of the masculine.
Where do you want this to go now?

(quippy opinion time)

Masculine style is more architectural than fashion.

Collars are a stand in for trapezoid muscles.

"great t-shirt" means "that fits you and you are in shape".

As a result, masculine style is more constant than feminine.

If you are to take on the mantle of the good masculine, you have to go out into the wildernesses of your life. Mental, cultural, etc. Practice healthy risk assessment, taking on burdens, disagreeing (with compassion).

Be kind, but also respected.
